poem:
**Digital Shadows**

of voices in  
the dark corners  
whispering silent  
screams, a thread  
unraveling—fragile  
minds in search.  
New laws  
stretch across  
an invisible sky;  
a net cast  
wide to catch  
the broken ones.

Leaves winter-bare,  
against the weight  
of a world  
asking to feel  
less alone.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Ofcom is investigating whether the site breached the Online Safety Act by failing to put in place adequate measures to shield its users from illegal content. The law requires tech platforms to tackle illegal material – such as encouraging suicide – or". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long.
